channel.title: Okay, help?
channel.description:
Okay, i downloaded the Kubunto OS or whatever, now i can select to load it up from my boot, at restart.
I like the toolbar, the icons, the desktop and such. But i can't find out how to do ALOT of stuff. Like i can't download this client i want for a Private-server..
I can't install firefox.. I can't move my trashbin to the desktop.. EVERYTHING on my computer moniter is small in Linux, but regular in Windows?
I can't figure out how to install stuff, it's DEFINATLY not like Windows.
Post help.

item.title: Okay, help?
item.dc:creator: @Painless Painless
item.description:
@Painless wrote:

Easy way, imo, to install programs is to go into the big K button then go System > Adept Manager and search for the file you want to download.

As for the Trashbin. It’s on the taskbar, do you really need it on the desktop?

Read full topic

item.title: Okay, help?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

it looks like you use kubuntu? (either that or there is a desto with one letter different, Kubunto)

open Konsole or Terminal, and write

sudo apt-get install firefox

as for the small-ness, that could be because you have a higher screen resolution set in linux
i dont remember exactly how to change it, but you could try googling “kde change screen resolution”

Read full topic

item.title: Okay, help?
item.dc:creator: @Mary_Jane Mary|Jane
item.description:
@Mary_Jane wrote:

Yes, i installed it as a dual-boot.

Now, i can’t find out how to install Opera, or Firefox.

And i really hate it’s web-browser,

Everything is mini. Like all the words i type, the words i read and such too.

Read full topic
